title: French Montana
summary: Karim Kharbouch (كريم خربوش Karīm Kharbūš [kæɾiːm χɑɾbuːʃ]; born November 9, 1984), better known by his stage name French Montana, is a Moroccan-American rapper managed by SAL&CO.[1] Born and raised in Morocco, he emigrated to the United States with his family when he was 13.[2][3] He is the founder of Coke Boys Records and its predecessor Cocaine City Records. After years of independent material, he was signed as joint-venture record deal with Puff Daddy's Bad Boy Records and Rick Ross's Maybach Music Group in 2012.
